name: Pickthall
text: The Beneficent

name: Pickthall
text: Hath made known the Qur'an.

name: Pickthall
text: He hath created man.

name: Pickthall
text: He hath taught him utterance.

name: Pickthall
text: The sun and the moon are made punctual.

name: Pickthall
text: The stars and the trees prostrate.

name: Pickthall
text: And the sky He hath uplifted; and He hath set the measure,

name: Pickthall
text: That ye exceed not the measure,

name: Pickthall
text: But observe the measure strictly, nor fall short thereof.

name: Pickthall
text: And the earth hath He appointed for (His) creatures,

name: Pickthall
text: Wherein are fruit and sheathed palm-trees,

name: Pickthall
text: Husked grain and scented herb.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: He created man of clay like the potter's,

name: Pickthall
text: And the jinn did He create of smokeless fire.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: Lord of the two Easts, and Lord of the two Wests!

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: He hath loosed the two seas. They meet.

name: Pickthall
text: There is a barrier between them. They encroach not (one upon the other).

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: There cometh forth from both of them the pearl and coral-stone.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: His are the ships displayed upon the sea, like banners.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: Everyone that is thereon will pass away;

name: Pickthall
text: There remaineth but the Countenance of thy Lord of Might and Glory.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: All that are in the heavens and the earth entreat Him. Every day He exerciseth (universal) power.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: We shall dispose of you, O ye two dependents (man and jinn).

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: O company of jinn and men, if ye have power to penetrate (all) regions of the heavens and the earth, then penetrate (them)! Ye will never penetrate them save with (Our) sanction.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: There will be sent, against you both, heat of fire and flash of brass, and ye will not escape.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: And when the heaven splitteth asunder and becometh rosy like red hide -

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny? -

name: Pickthall
text: On that day neither man nor jinni will be questioned of his sin.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: The guilty will be known by their marks, and will be taken by the forelocks and the feet.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: This is hell which the guilty deny.

name: Pickthall
text: They go circling round between it and fierce, boiling water.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: But for him who feareth the standing before his Lord there are two gardens.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: Of spreading branches.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: Wherein are two fountains flowing.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: Wherein is every kind of fruit in pairs.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: Reclining upon couches lined with silk brocade, the fruit of both the gardens near to hand.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: Therein are those of modest gaze, whom neither man nor jinni will have touched before them.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: (In beauty) like the jacynth and the coral-stone.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: Is the reward of goodness aught save goodness?

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: And beside them are two other gardens,

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: Dark green with foliage.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: Wherein are two abundant springs.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: Wherein is fruit, the date-palm and pomegranate.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: Wherein (are found) the good and beautiful -

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny? -

name: Pickthall
text: Fair ones, close-guarded in pavilions -

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny? -

name: Pickthall
text: Whom neither man nor jinni will have touched before them -

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: Reclining on green cushions and fair carpets.

name: Pickthall
text: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny?

name: Pickthall
text: Blessed be the name of thy Lord, Mighty and glorious!
